intro: Calyptrogyne panamensis subsp. panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian calyptrogyne, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves with a hairy underside, and it produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
